Title.evidence: Randomised Controlled Trial of Ceramic-on-Ceramic vs. Metal-on-Polyethylene Bearings in Total Hip Arthroplasty

Participants.evidence: Eligibility criteria included patients undergoing total hip arthroplasty.

Intervention.evidence: randomised to receive either alumina ceramic bearings (144 hips) or cobalt chrome-on-polyethylene bearings (72 hips)

Method_Outcome.evidence: The primary outcome was the survivorship of the bearing surface and implant systems over a minimum of 10 years

Randomisation_Allocation.evidence: Randomisation was achieved using a computer-generated sequence, and allocation was concealed.

Number_Analysed.evidence: Kaplan-Meier survivorship analysis revealed no significant difference

Result_Outcome.evidence: Revisions for any reason were significantly lower in the ceramic group (3.1%) compared to the control group (10.5%).

Harms.evidence: Squeaking was reported in 1.4% of the ceramic group.

Trial_Registration.evidence: Trial registration and funding information were not provided.

Funding.evidence: Trial registration and funding information were not provided.
